Database

Class BankDatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.BankDatabaseController

  • public class BankDatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a wrapper for the SQL queries to the database for the Bank and BankAccount objects. It also creates objects of these classes and save the new object information to the database when a new Game is started. These objects are fundamentally linked, because only the Bank owns and has access to the BankAccounts.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BankDatabaseController getInstance()
        Static function for the singleton design pattern, this is used by other classes instead of calling the constructor.
        Returns:
        BankDatabaseController the existing instance, or a new object if no instance currently exists

      • getBankByID

        public Bank getBankByID(int bankID)
        This gets the Bank from the database that corresponds to the unique id key. If successful it returns a new Bank object with the data values belonging to that Bank, otherwise it returns a NULL Bank object.
        Parameters:
        bankID - the id of the bank
        Returns:
        Bank the new object or null

      • getAccountByID

        public BankAccount getAccountByID(int accountID)
        This gets the BankAccount from the database that corresponds to the unique id key. If successful it returns a new BankAccount object with the data values belonging to that BankAccount, otherwise it returns a NULL BankAccount object.
        Parameters:
        accountID - the id of the account
        Returns:
        BankAccount the new object or null

      • getAccountListByBankID

        public java.util.ArrayList<BankAccount> getAccountListByBankID(int bankID)
        This gets the entire set of BankAccounts from the database that corresponds to the unique id key of a particular Bank. If not successful it returns a NULL ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        bankID - the id of the bank
        Returns:
        ArrayList of BankAccounts

      • updateBankNumberHouses

        public boolean updateBankNumberHouses(int bankID,
                                      int numberOfHouses)
        This updates the database information for the number of houses belonging to the Bank with the given unique id key.
        Parameters:
        bankID - the unique id key of the Bank in the database
        numberOfHouses - the new number of houses owned by that Bank
        Returns:
        boolean if successful returns true, otherwise it returns false

      • updateCashBalance

        public boolean updateCashBalance(BankAccount account)
        This updates the database information for cash balance of the given BankAccount. Precondition: The new cash balance to be saved to the database must already have been updated in the given BankAccount object, and exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        account - the BankAccount to update in the database
        Returns:
        boolean if successful returns true, otherwise it returns false

      • addNewBank

        public Bank addNewBank(int[] playerIDs)
        This creates a new Bank object and saves it to the database. If successful it returns a new Bank object, otherwise it returns a NULL Bank object.
        Parameters:
        playerIDs - all the players that need to have new BankAccounts in the new Bank.
        Returns:
        Bank the new object or null

      • addNewBankAccount

        public BankAccount addNewBankAccount(int bankID,
                                     int playerID)
        This creates a new BankAccount object and saves it to the database. If successful it returns a new BankAccount object, otherwise it returns a NULL BankAccount object.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the Player that has the new BankAccount
        bankID - the Bank that owns the new BankAccount
        Returns:
        BankAccount the new object or null

      • deleteBank

        public boolean deleteBank(int bankID)
        Deletes the Bank with the given unique id key from the database.
        Parameters:
        bankID - the id of the Bank
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if successful, or false if not successful

      • deleteBankAccount

        public boolean deleteBankAccount(int accountID)
        Deletes the BankAccount with the given unique id key from the database.
        Parameters:
        accountID - the id of the bank account
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if successful, or false if not successful
